Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board.java Stores and updates the playing board of the game.
    Version:
    0.9
    Author:
    Ewan Bradford, Sam Forster, Luke Francis

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(Drawable[][] board,
             java.util.ArrayList<Movable> movables,
             java.util.ArrayList<Interactable> interactables)
        Creates a board with from static, movable and interactable data.
        Parameters:
        board, - a 2D array of the static elements of the board.
        movables, - the elements that will move around the 2D board array.
        interactables, - these are the elements that will interact with the player.

    • Method Detail

      • drawBoard

                      int playerX,
                      int playerY)
        Draws all the static tiles of the board
        Parameters:
        gc, - the graphics context to be drawn to
        playerX, - the current x coordinate of the player
        playerY, - the current y coordinate of the player

      • updateBoard

        public void updateBoard(Player player,
                        int keyboardIn)
        Updates all the static tiles of the board
        Parameters:
        player, - the player object playing the level
        keyboardIn, - the current key press from the user

      • drawMovables

                         int playerX,

        Parameters:
        gc, - graphics context to be drawn to
        playerX, - the current x coordinate of the player
        playerY, - the current y coordinate of the player

      • updateMovables

        public void updateMovables(Player player,
                           int keyboardIn)
        Updates all of the movables on the board
        Parameters:
        player, - the player object that is playing the board.
        keyboardIn, - the current input from the keyboard. (0 representing noon, 1 three o'clock etc)

      • getBlocking

        public int getBlocking(int x,
                       int y)
        Checks if there is any blocking entities at a given cell.
        Parameters:
        x, - the x coordinate to be checked.
        y, - the y coordinate to be checked.
        Returns:
        Returns the highest blocking value that is present at that position.
